page.title: 13A FARLEY CHILD'S DAY CONT'D
page.content: Some of the hymns we sing are, "All things bright and beautiful," "Morning has broken" and more. After assembly we go back to our classrooms to do science until twenty to eleven and then we have break until eleven. After break we do maths until lunch which is at mid-day. We finish lunch at half past twelve and have break until one o'clock. Then we have sport until two o'clock. After that we normally read or do English. At twenty to three we listen to a radio programme. From quarter to three to three we often recite our tables. At three o'clock school finishes, but some of us do gym club and then we go home. When I get home I play with my friends and have tea at six o'clock. I play or watch television until bed time about half past nine.
